thread.title: Truth IS out there: NASA finds 'alien-life-supporting' planets in our galaxy
thread.title_full: Truth IS out there: NASA finds 'alien-life-supporting' planets in our galaxy

title: Truth IS out there: NASA finds 'alien-life-supporting' planets in our galaxy
text:
GOLDILOCKS: Some of the planets are in the right conditions to have oceans 
These telescopes are now searching to find out if the planets have an atmosphere. 
In the future, experts may develop telescopes powerful enough to detect signs of life such as oxygen in the atmosphere. 
Dr Emmanuel Jehin, another member of the Liege team, said: "We will soon be able to search for water and perhaps even evidence of life on these worlds." 2016: Amazing pictures taken from a year in space Wednesday, 21st December 2016 2016 was a year full of new stunning imagery taken from Space 1 / 15 NASA Aug. 19, 2016: Expedition 48 Commander Jeff Williams (shown here) and Flight Engineer Kate Rubins of NASA successfully installed the first of two international docking adapters during a five hour and 58-minute spacewalk 
The first expo-planet was discovered in 1992 and since then astronomers have catalogued more than 3,500 worlds in 2,675 star systems. 
Space boffins hope that these planets could one day support human colonies migrating to the stars. 
Around one-fifth of stars similar to earth's sun are thought to have an earth-sized planet in their habitable zones. 
This leads many experts to believe there may be as many as 40 billion habitable worlds in our galaxy. Related articles
